bibl.idno: Papers of Jefferson Randolph Kean [manuscript] / Jefferson Randolph Kean, 1860-1950. MSS 628. The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va.

bibl.title: Letter from L. O. Howard to Jefferson Randolph Kean, June 7, 1901

div1.p: Howard identifies the species of mosquito that Kean sent him. He also inquires about Gorgas' work in Cuba and believes Woodruff would be a good addition to the investigating committee. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from L. O. Howard to Jefferson Randolph Kean, June 7, 1901
div1.opener:
UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE,
DIVISION OF ENTOMOLOGY,
WASHINGTON, D. C.
L. O. HOWARD, ENTOMOLOGIST.
C. L. MARLATT, }
F. H. CHITTENDEN }
ASSISTANT ENTOMOLOGISTS.
June 7, 1901.
Dear Doctor Kean:
div1.p:
I have yours of the 1st, with accompanying
specimens. No. 1 is Culex pungens, No. 2 is Culex taenio-
rhynchus, and No. 3 is Culex impiger, so you see your de-
terminations were practically correct. I am very glad to
get the specimens, and always glad to hear from you. I
am sorry to hear that you have been relieved from work which
keeps you in touch with mosquito matters. I shall be very
much obliged to you if you will let me know how Major Gorgas'
work is coming on. Perhaps he will write me himself. I have
had several letters from him in the past few months. How do
you think Dr. Woodruff would like to be transferred down
there? I hope you can get it for him if he wants it, be-
cause I think he is a fine fellow and a born investigator.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, L. O. Howard Col. J. R. Kean, U. S. A.,
Columbia Barracks,
Cuba.
Distinguished Entomologist Dept of Agriculture
Leland Ossian Howard, 1857.
